text: Grevillea crassifolia is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area along the south coast of the Great Southern region of Western Australia. The open shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple flat, undissected elliptic leaves that are long and wide. The inflorescence is raceme with irregular red flowers that appear between June and December. It will produce a simple hairy ovoid fruit that is long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== crassifolia Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia
title: Grevillea crassifolia
